quizzes.question: Which line of code writes "Hello world!" to a file?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Writing Files[/h1]

To write to files you use the [b]write [/b]method, which writes a string to the file.
[b]For example:[/b] [code format="py" codeId="354"]file = open("newfile.txt", "w")
file.[b]write[/b]("This has been written to a file")
file.close()

file = open("newfile.txt", "r")
print(file.read())
file.close()[/code]
[b]Result:[/b] [code format="raw" ]>>>
This has been written to a file
>>>[/code]
[note]The "w" mode will create a file, if it does not already exist.[/note]

answers.text: A blank line is written to the file

quizzes.question: What happens if you open a file in write mode and then immediately close it?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Writing Files[/h1]

When a file is opened in write mode, the file's existing content is deleted.[code format="py" codeId="355"]file = open("newfile.txt", "r")
print("Reading initial contents")
print(file.read())
print("Finished")
file.close()

file = open("newfile.txt", "w")
file.write("Some new text")
file.close()

file = open("newfile.txt", "r")
print("Reading new contents")
print(file.read())
print("Finished")
file.close()[/code]
[b]Result: [/b][code format="raw" ]>>>
Reading initial contents
some initial text
Finished
Reading new contents
Some new text
Finished
>>>[/code]
[note]As you can see, the content of the file has been overwritten.[/note]

quizzes.question: If a file write operation is successful, which one of these statements will be true?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Writing Files[/h1]

The [b]write [/b]method returns the number of [b]bytes [/b]written to a file, if successful.[code format="py" codeId="356"]msg = "Hello world!"
file = open("newfile.txt", "w")
amount_written = file.write(msg)
print(amount_written)
file.close()[/code]
[b]Result:[/b] [code format="raw" ]>>>
12
>>>[/code]
